dir-section.heading: Education
dir-section.p: Pre-school education, for children aged from three to six years, is available free of charge. Education is compulsory for eight years, between seven and 15 years of age. Primary education continues for four years. Secondary education lasts for up to eight years, comprising two cycles of four years each. There are various types of secondary school: grammar, technical and specialized schools, and mixed-curriculum schools. In 2019/20 the pre-primary education enrolment ratio was equivalent to 71.0% of children in the relevant age-group. In 2020/21 98.0% of children in the relevant age-group were enrolled at primary schools; enrolment at lower secondary schools included 98.7% of children in the appropriate age-group, while enrolment at upper secondary schools included 91.9% of children in the relevant age-group (males 89.5%; females 94.5%). Spending on education was equivalent to 6.1% of total budgetary expenditure in 2023, according to government estimates.
